subject: Politics
title: Ground Game vs Air War
description: A 60-second lesson on Ground Game vs Air War.

hook.text: TV ads reach millions. Door-knocking reaches one voter at a time. Both matter, but differently.

buildup.text: The 'air war' is media advertising. The 'ground game' is canvassing, phone banking, and grassroots organizing.

discovery.text: Studies show personal contact â€” knocking on doors â€” is the most effective way to increase voter turnout.

twist.text: Trump in 2016 won with a weak ground game but massive media attention. The rules keep changing.

climax.text: Digital organizing blends both. Social media acts as an air war and ground game simultaneously.

punchline.text: Ads make you known. Volunteers make you win. You need both.

quiz.question: What is the most effective method for increasing voter turnout?
